result.execSummary:
The defendant Marcus G Human was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If revoked:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for  Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Sentence credit is set at zero.
Consecutive to: any other sentence currently serving, if revoked.
Same Conditions for Extended Supervision apply as to Conditions for Probation if revoked.
Consecutive to: Any other sentence currently serving.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($368) and DNA surcharge ($250) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling.

Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Submit to random U.A.'s.   
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No drug paraphernalia. 
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed. 
Inform Agent of all prescriptions. 
No contact with Alicia P., her family or residence.
Domestic violence counseling. 
Anger Management. 
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

records.addlTxt: letter dated 7/10/15 filed by Mr. Human; requesting a copy of his JOC
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Marcus G Human in court, in custody, with attorney Mark E. Kershek.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a plea of no contest to Count 2,  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 1 and Ct. 3 dismissed and read-in. 

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 2:
- Total sentence: 24 months (Initial Confinement: 18 months, Extended Supervision: 6 months) - consecutive to any other sentence the defendant is serving Stayed for 2 years Probation consecutive to
any sentence the defendant is serving. Credit set at Zero.
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $368.00 (includes DV Surcharge) to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution set at zero.
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent. No contact with Alicia P., her family or residence. Domestic violence counseling. Anger Management.  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
with attached witness list filed by the State.
